programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: Short 18: Documentary following snowplough teams and RAC patrols in Scotland and the north of England as they work to ensure the roads are clear if winter weather hits

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Officers are called to a serious accident near Skipton involving a motorbike, while a group of bikers get into an altercation with a motorist on the road to Harrogate, allegedly forcing him off the road and assaulting him. At the start of the Easter weekend, a rider loses control in a potentially fatal accident and a collision investigation unit is called to the scene
S06E09

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
A trailer carrying gym weights rolls over on a busy roundabout and requires heavy recovery vehicles, while another trailer is badly damaged after a bridge strike. A routine job to rescue a powerless van is complicated by a high sided horse-box
S05E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A reckless car thief seems intent on causing carnage, while the pursuit of an unlicensed driver through a housing estate has grave consequences. Inspector Ed Turner turns up more than he bargains for when the pursuit of a suspected heroin user takes a turn for the worse, and elsewhere officers face one of the biggest challenges of their careers when a stolen JCB goes on the rampage
S11E11

programme.title: Tumbleweed (1953)
programme.desc: A scout visits a Native American tribe to negotiate safe passage for a wagon train, but while he is away, the settlers are attacked and killed. He is falsely accused of leaving them to die and sentenced to hang, but breaks out of jail and tries to clear his name by bringing the culprits to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Lori Nelson

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Tumbleweed (1953)
programme.desc: A scout visits a Native American tribe to negotiate safe passage for a wagon train, but while he is away, the settlers are attacked and killed. He is falsely accused of leaving them to die and sentenced to hang, but breaks out of jail and tries to clear his name by bringing the culprits to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Lori Nelson

programme.title: Ride Clear of Diablo (1954)
programme.desc: A gunslinger is devastated when his entire family are murdered, and sets out to find those responsible. Along the way, he encounters a mercenary who has been hired to finish him off - but events take an unexpected turn as the duo end up joining forces. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea, Susan Cabot, Abbe Lane and Russell Johnson

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Ride Clear of Diablo (1954)
programme.desc: A gunslinger is devastated when his entire family are murdered, and sets out to find those responsible. programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Steve comes to the rescue when a trailer rolls over on a busy roundabout on the A46, scattering hay bales everywhere. In south London, recovery op Merrie faces a boggy recovery nightmare
S04E03

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Officers in Harrogate spot a youth behaving suspiciously, but when they try to stop him, he flees into a local housing estate and things rapidly escalate as a hostile crowd gathers. On the southern border of North Yorkshire, some more youngsters catch the eye of the traffic cops when it appears the driver is using a mobile phone. As they attempt to pull the car over, the suspects speed off and the chase is on. The police conduct a raid on a house near York, on the hunt for a suspected drug dealer, while a routine patrol takes a sinister turn when a man in a bar is spotted with a knife
S06E10

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The work of Cheshire's high-speed police interception unit, whose patch is one of the UK's most affluent areas. In the first edition, Tom tries to stop a suspected petrol thief who is not willing to pull over, Bucko and Chris meet a mouthy driver who refuses to come quietly, Mike helps to carry out a textbook tactical pursuit and containment, and Jim deals with a drunk, foul-mouthed racist who has bladder-control issues
S12E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Rich Woodward is on the hunt for a suspect in an uninsured vehicle that has been spotted swerving along the motorway. PC Ian Cosgrove is making his way through rush-hour traffic on the M6 to reach the scene of a hit-and-run where two vehicles have collided and there are reports of a car being stuck on a live lane
S02E07

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers come under attack from a gang of violent armed robbers, while Jon and Chris have their work cut out catching up with a dangerous speeder. Plus, the 'Big Blue Van' respond to reports of bottles raining down on the streets and a routine stop on a delivery driver leads one of the interceptors to discover more than he bargained for
S12E04

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S06E01

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
Officers respond to a report of a two-vehicle crash, but when they arrive at the scene only one of the cars is present, leading them to suspect the other driver has fled as he may have been over the drink-drive limit. In the early hours, an emergency call comes in of a theft in which a man broke into a car, but was disturbed by the owner and is now on the run
S02E05

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Tornadoes tear through Texas, rip tides trap swimmers in Florida, a storm hits holiday makers in Greece and a wave crashes through a restaurant in Italy
S03E10

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Driver Steve Grahame discovers his vehicle has taken a battering during the past three days, over which he has hauled 130 tons of goods across 2,000km
S02E03

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Turbo embarks on a journey through an area affected by bush fires, and Yogi faces the biggest week of his career
S02E04

S04E07

programme.desc:
A deadly volcano eruption causes catastrophic destruction, a tornado flips cars on a highway, and the HMS Coast Guard carry out a daring rescue mission
S03E07

programme.title: Duel in the Sun (1946)
programme.desc: A hellraising cowboy and his clean-cut brother fall into a bitter feud over a beautiful girl, while their father - a Texan senator and cattle baron - fiercely resists the encroachment of land by the railroad companies and the settlers arriving in their wake. King Vidor's Western, starring Gregory Peck, Joseph Cotten, Jennifer Jones, Lionel Barrymore and Lillian Gish

programme.desc: An intelligence officer is captured by the Nazis who trick him into thinking the conflict is over, hoping he will reveal details of a major Allied operation. Second World War espionage adventure, starring James Garner, Eva Marie Saint, Rod Taylor and Werner Peters

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
When a 44-to truck rolls over and blocks a busy dual carriageway in Derby, operations manager Steve needs all his know-how to tackle the job. Plus, a van leaves the road and lands in Lock Eck, sinking 20 metres to the bottom, and a bus that has broken down on a busy road needs rescuing
S05E04

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
An 80mph pursuit carries on for 15 miles across North Yorkshire, while wet roads make a 90mph chase near Scarborough even more dangerous. Another pursuit is aborted when the driver pulls over to relieve himself, and officers find an open crate of lager in his car. Jamie Theakston presents
S06E11

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jim leads a raid on a suspected drug dealer, Dan and Gordy respond to reports of an attack in an alleyway, and Jon goes on the hunt for a serial drug driver. Elsewhere, the interceptors combine forces when they fear that a gun-toting brawler may be on the loose
S12E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Tim and Tom team up with Merseyside police to carry out a raid on a house in Liverpool, Jim wrestles with an aggressive driver, and officers armed with Tasers respond to an alleged assault with a meat cleaver. Plus, Dicko is called upon when a young man is stabbed in a street brawl
S12E06

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
In North Yorkshire, police are out in force on a bank holiday weekend, and a high-speed pursuit ensues after a driver fails to stop and drives at a police officer. In the Dales, there's a special operation under way to crack down on motorists flouting the law, including motorcyclists riding without tax or insurance, and speeding. A biker takes a tumble down a steep embankment after losing control on a bend, somehow miraculously escaping serious injury. Jamie Theakston presents.
S12E15

programme.title: Hang 'Em High (1968)
programme.desc: A lawman-turned-rancher is attacked by a lynch mob and hanged for a crime he did not commit, but is rescued before he dies. He returns to his former profession to hunt the mob down, but his desire for revenge clashes with his responsibility to bring them to trial alive. Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Inger Stevens, Ed Begley, James MacArthur, Pat Hingle, Bruce Dern and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: Shootout (1971)
programme.desc: An ageing bank robber is released from jail after eight years behind bars and goes in search of his former partner, who double-crossed him in the wake of an ill-fated heist. His mission of vengeance is complicated when he learns of the death of an old flame, and finds himself forced to take care of her six-year-old daughter. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Pat Quinn and Robert F Lyons

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jim and the team take to the road to spring a trap on suspected drug dealers, while Dan and Gordy track down a man seen roaming the streets armed with two knives. John picks up the pieces of a multi-car pile-up, and an early morning raid sees officers break down doors in search of class-A drugs

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Andy Doran pulls over a driver for using his mobile phone behind the wheel and the situation escalates when the driver continues to avoid Andy's questions. On the M53, PC Chris Swash pulls over a car that is being driven at over 90mph and detects a strong smell of cannabis, so performs a drug test, while PC Amy Hollis is called to the scene of a two-vehicle collision near Cheshire Oaks
S02E08

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:

programme.title: In Old California (1942)
programme.desc: A Boston pharmacist joins the California gold rush and pitches up in Sacramento, where the crooked brothers who run the town take an instant dislike to him - and frame him by poisoning his medical supplies. Rejected by the community, he makes plans to leave - but when the town is hit by an epidemic, he resolves to stay on and save those who once turned on him. Western, starring John Wayne, Binnie Barnes, and Albert Dekker

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
An elderly woman near York has collapsed in her bathroom, jamming the door shut. Near the Yorkshire Dales, an elderly man driving without his glasses is responsible for a hit and run. And in Filey, North Yorkshire, a people-carrier has collided with a mobility scooter. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

Jenno gets a faceful of pepper spray, Jim has to deal with a mouthy drink driver, and Tom hunts down a violent armed robber

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Near Scarborough, there's a force-wide hunt for a group of dangerous and violent thieves on the run. As officers give chase to two stolen vehicles, their lives are put at risk as their cars are rammed and damaged by the thieves desperate to get away. In York, as the pubs and clubs kick out, a routine stop of riders on electric scooters suspected of drink driving leads to confrontation and difficult arrests
S12E16

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc:
A devastating rampage of distressing and targeted burglaries is terrorising the elderly and vulnerable around a single town. The MO is the same every time and the police are called out almost daily to yet another ransacked address, but the perpetrator evades them. Detectives quickly suspect that the break-ins might be the work of one man who is known to them, so Inspector Tom Smith and his CID team need to find and apprehend him fast - and that's not going to be easy

Drugs Bust: Ortis Deley follows officers from Cleveland and Durham's specialist unit as they embark on a series of operations targeting crimes connected to narcotics. From chasing down people driving under the influence of drugs to raiding cannabis factories, Sgt Kevin Salter and his crew take on the drug game's key players in the north-east of England. Showcasing all the action of one eventful night, Ortis is in the thick of it as the interceptors ultimately seize more than 500,000 of contraband

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc:
Dr Xand van Tulleken and Ashley John-Baptiste put the three-second rule to the test and investigate the 'Lion Diet' social media trend. Liam and Helen share the story of their diagnosis with mesothelioma, a cancer caused by asbestos that is completely preventable. Plus, the story of a woman who faked a DNA paternity test to deny her ex-partner access to his child
S01E02

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Episode 1 (Shortened): A team is called to a serious mountain-bike crash in the Borders and must treat the patient on a remote hillside, before working out how to get her safely to hospital

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts and the team explore a semi-detached in Felixstowe, a bungalow in Willenhall and a trendy warehouse apartment in Toxteth
S26E15

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Southwell 1: Roo Irvine hosts the show from Southwell Racecourse, and gets help from members of the public in identifying a mystery object. With experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall
S62E03

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Home Comforts: Imogen worries about Rob in the aftermath of Karen's death and Suni, Bear and Sid go to a restaurant opening. Jimmi helps a mother and daughter deal with generational trauma
S24E48

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
The team is in west London to help the Parkinson family. With four young children, the house is overrun with toys and the hallway is a dumping ground
S01E03

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Surrey: Steve Brown helps a woman and her dog find a home in Surrey on a budget of 500,000. They also visit a Grade one listed cemetery where they meet volunteers who maintain grounds
S23E43

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers enter the Bidding Room. First in is Claire with an optician's testing lamp, followed by Geoff with a six foot gorilla called Gary. Jonathan brings in an Astra compass for the dealers to bid on and Nathan presents his childhood Ghostbusters house and figurines. Last in are Jemma and Jasmine with a push-along dog named Freddie
S04E21

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S02E12

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Rose Matafeo
S29E12

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Roman Kemp present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Denise comes clean to Jack about her affair and all hell breaks loose as he goes to confront Ravi. Chelsea is heartbroken by the news and orders Ravi out of her life

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc:
Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr: The designers work alone to transform hair salons in Bristol. With each salon giving a different brief, a budget of 3,000 and just two days to complete the makeover, the designers have their work cut out for them in the semi-final. Monika embraces her gothic maximalist signature style to renovate her classic salon with a unique charm and starts with a black paint job. Tom has the challenge of modernising an industrial salon and giving a fresh edge to the rugged and characterful interior. The owners of a high-end salon that aims to deliver a luxury experience asked Jack for a Scandi makeover but he decides to take it one step further with a style he calls 'Japandi'
S04E07

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
Nine home cooks take on the audition round in the second week of heats, hoping to impress John and Gregg who are blind taste-testing their dishes and picking the top three to fast track into the next round of the competition. The remaining six cooks face an invention test under the watchful eye of John and Gregg and two will be going home
S19E04

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc:
The Small World of Florian Selby: Selby comes to Costello with a risky offer after reuniting with a friend from prison. Iris confides in Gloria about problems at school and Costello goes on an underwhelming date
S01E03

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc:
Great Reputations: Obie swears to Grace's mother that his friends will behave at the Guggenheim but it turns out to be a promise he can't keep. Though she's finally the new queen of Constance, Monet yearns for a real rivalry with Julien
S02E03

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc:
One Flew Over Cuck's Nest: Monet desperately wants to be liked, but ruling through fear isn't doing her any favours. Julien struggles to show Grace's true colours to Obie and Audrey and Max suspect Aki is keeping a secret
S02E04

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc:
Rosamund Kissi-Debrah shares the story of her daughter's death from pollution and surgeon Dr Greg Williams gives tips on choosing the right place to get a hair transplant and avoiding the dodgy practitioners who offer cheap surgery and leave patients with botched jobs and scarred scalps. Plus, the story of former surgeon Ian Paterson who was convicted of 17 counts of wounding with intent and sentenced to 20 years in prison
S01E03

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Episode 2 (Shortened): In Ayr, a teenager has fallen off a rope swing and paramedics need to assess his back and spine in case he has suffered a serious injury

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development progress of properties in Carlisle, Rosyth and Shepherd's Bush
S25E54

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Bath 17: Stephanie Connell and Raj Bisram help two teams look for items at Bath Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles finds out about the history of the humble spoon
S57E16

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Optics: Bear meets an old friend from university and Jimmi discovers the Beechwalk is being sold. New midwife Malika struggles with a young couple who have just given birth
S24E49

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
The team heads to Bristol to help family members struggling to find space for all their bikes. The unusual layout of their front room needs some clever thinking to maximise the space and storage
S01E04

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
East Riding of Yorkshire: Jules Hudson helps a Kent family find a new home in the East Riding of Yorkshire with room for a catering business, and takes a trip on a traditional fishing boat in Bridlington
S21E12

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers presents as five more people bring their items to the dealers to sell. First in is Billy with a large two-seater spaceship from the funfair, followed by Nyree with a French decanter she found in a charity shop. Next in is Lee with a 1970s pay phone in original and working condition and Kevin with a Hornby train set he has owned for 60 years. Finally, Carole enters hoping luck is on her side as she tries to sell her tombola machine
S04E22

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S02E13

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Amy and Howie finally learns the real reason behind the crash. Phil convinces Sharon to host a community boxing match but it could mean trouble for Zack. Suki makes a shocking discovery

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc:
The Highs and Lows of a Kosher Marriage - Love, Faith & Me: Happily married couple Saul and Shoshi hope that following Jewish marriage rituals can help them through the tough times. As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month
S02E05

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.desc:

Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.desc:

The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the start of the 43rd staging of the 26.2-mile race, as approximately 50,000 competitors take to the streets of the capital. programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Amy and Howie finally learns the real reason behind the crash. Phil convinces Sharon to host a community boxing match but it could mean trouble for Zack. Suki makes a shocking discovery

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.desc:

As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance
S02E03

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

Leicester and Wolves are among a number of teams battling to avoid relegation, while Forest are also in danger, but did prevail 1-0 when they met Liverpool at the City Ground in October. Plus, Fulham v Leeds United, Brentford v Aston Villa and Crystal Palace v Everton

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the start of the 43rd staging of the 26.2-mile race, as approximately 50,000 competitors take to the streets of the capital. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Politics South
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies
S02E02

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Portchester 1: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value
S44E15

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc:
Joe is horrified at the toll London life is taken on an opium-addicted Pip, and tries to persuade him to return to the safety of Gravesend. An unsuspected threat from the past emerges when Pip discovers the true identity of his mysterious benefactor. Frustrated by Estella's reluctance to marry Drummle, Miss Havisham foists another unsuspected suitor on her daughter, who is driven to desperate lengths to seize control of her life

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. He becomes fascinated by a mysterious American who moves in next door, and the new arrival offers him some advice on how to be cool. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the start of the 43rd staging of the 26.2-mile race, as approximately 50,000 competitors take to the streets of the capital. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Amy and Howie finally learns the real reason behind the crash. Phil convinces Sharon to host a community boxing match but it could mean trouble for Zack. Suki makes a shocking discovery

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars

He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

Sparks fly when Marlene meets an outspoken farmer who hates the police, who has accused a rival of sabotaging her milking equipment. Not only does he have an alibi, but he responds with a counter accusation of dumping toxic waste. Meanwhile, a stressed-out Finn is pushed to breaking point
