programme.desc:
A team of cleaners and DIY experts has just one day to help a household reclaim their space and fall back in love with their home. Here, the squad visits south Wales, coming to the rescue of a busy entrepreneur who has no time to 'fix! her house. They must organise her messy living room into a space that the whole family can use and where she can run her business effectively, while also cleaning and organising months of clutter and grime. Presented by Asher Edwards, Maxine Dwyer and Tommy Walsh

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc:
Joe is horrified at the toll London life is taken on an opium-addicted Pip, and tries to persuade him to return to the safety of Gravesend. Frustrated by Estella's reluctance to marry Drummle, Miss Havisham foists another unsuspected suitor on her daughter, who is driven to desperate lengths to seize control of her life

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day four at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusions of Robert Milkins v Joe Perry and Gary Wilson v Elliot Slessor in the first round. Milkins has been a professional since 1995, but his last appearance in the main draw was in 2018, when he reached the second round. Wilson was a semi-finalist in 2019, but that is the only occasion he has progressed beyond this stage

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The Two Winstons: The historian draws on the lives of Winston Churchill and George Orwell, who created the hero Winston Smith in his novel 1984. These men had a huge personal impact on the historian and touched many of the key events of the 20th century, including the World Wars and the Depression
S01E15

programme.title: Chris Packham: In Search of the Lost Girl
programme.desc: The presenter returns to Sumatra, where 20 years previously he photographed a member of a nomadic hunter gatherer tribe and was struck by how her people lived in perfect harmony with their environment. He tries to track her down despite having no clues to her identity or whereabouts. However, he discovers the country has been devastated by deforestation in the intervening years, while many members of the tribe have been killed

programme.title: Measuring Mass: The Last Artefact
programme.desc: A hi-tech vault just outside Paris is the home of the kilogram, a small metallic cylinder that is used as the base unit of mass - it is the item against which everything else is measured. But over time, this small hunk of metal has mysteriously eroded by the weight of an eyelash, a change that could have dire consequences. This documentary tells the story of the kilogram, and follows a group of scientists as they try to redefine the weight of the world

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Colours of Earth: Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth
S01E01

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: The Power of the Placebo: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them
S50E08

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The Two Winstons: The historian draws on the lives of Winston Churchill and George Orwell, who created the hero Winston Smith in his novel 1984. These men had a huge personal impact on the historian and touched many of the key events of the 20th century, including the World Wars and the Depression
S01E15

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day five at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Kyren Wilson v Ryan Day and the start of Shaun Murphy v Si Jiahui, both in the first round. Wilson, a runner-up in 2020, claimed a hard-fought 10-8 victory over 2016 finalist Ding Junhui at this stage last year, while Murphy suffered a defeat by the same score line at the hands of Stephen Maguire and now faces the player who eliminated him at this stage of the 2021 UK Championship

programme.title: Alex Higgins: The People's Champion
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates a look back at the often controversial life of the two-time world snooker champion, who was widely regarded as one of the most naturally gifted players in the history of his sport, but whose brilliance was flawed by his demons. With contributions by members of his family, as well as fellow snooker greats Jimmy White, Ronnie O'Sullivan, Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc:
Mini-series based on the novel by John McGahern, following a man growing old among a family who try to live through tragic circumstances. Moran is an overbearing father who believes himself to be benevolent, but the death of his wife makes his relationship with his five children increasingly difficult. Drama, starring Tony Doyle and Susan Lynch
S01E01

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc:
Maggie is reunited with Luke in London and meets her first love, while back at Great Meadow, Moran's other daughters confront their futures
S01E02

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Restoration work on the miller's cottage continues, but across the lane building works at the mill grind to halt as the planning authorities investigate local objections to Griff Rhys Jones's plans. Meanwhile, the comedian makes plans for a music festival
S02E03

programme.title: The Joy of Winning
programme.desc: A witty, mind-expanding guide in which Hannah Fry unlocks the essential strategies a person needs to get what they want - to win more of the time. The mathematician also hails 20th-century scientists John von Neumann and John Nash, who worked out the science of success and reveals how the same rules apply to the world's biggest problems - whether its avoiding nuclear annihilation or tackling climate change

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc:
Gauguin's Vision After the Sermon: Waldemar Januszczak examines Gauguin's Vision After the Sermon,an epic 17th-century religious painting exploring temptation and desire. He uncovers some unusual connections with sumo wrestling, Victor Hugo's Les Miserables, and a 17-year-old girl called Madeleine
S01E03

programme.title: Chris Packham: In Search of the Lost Girl
programme.desc: The presenter returns to Sumatra, where 20 years previously he photographed a member of a nomadic hunter gatherer tribe and was struck by how her people lived in perfect harmony with their environment. He tries to track her down despite having no clues to her identity or whereabouts. However, he discovers the country has been devastated by deforestation in the intervening years, while many members of the tribe have been killed

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Shaun Murphy v Si Jiahui in round one, and the start of a second-round contest. Murphy was a champion in 2005 and has been a runner-up on three occasions since, most recently when he was defeated by Mark Selby two years ago, but he lost to Stephen Maguire in the first round in 2022

programme.title: School for Scoundrels (1960)
programme.desc: A timid company owner is pushed around by his employees, deceived by a car salesman, humiliated by a waiter and finally loses his girlfriend to a dastardly rival. Salvation comes in the form of an unusual college dedicated to teaching students how to succeed through being manipulative and devious, and he sets about getting even with his enemies. Comedy, starring Ian Carmichael, Terry-Thomas, Alastair Sim and Janette Scott

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt (1953)
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc:
Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: British Comedy: The critic returns to examines more of the techniques and conventions behind classic movie genres, beginning by looking at the tropes of British comedies. Mark argues that they win laughs by tapping into the public's abiding national preoccupations, from rooting for the underdog to the subversion of class and manners, as well as the audience's fascination with comedy and crime, and pastiches and parodies that take the big beasts of Hollywood down a peg or two
S03E01

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction
S2017E09

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Restoration work on the miller's cottage continues, but across the lane building works at the mill grind to halt as the planning authorities investigate local objections to Griff Rhys Jones's plans. Meanwhile, the comedian makes plans for a music festival
S02E03

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Colours of Earth: Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth
S01E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day seven at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two second-round contests. Neil Robertson could be getting his second-round match under way in this session should he have won his opener, and he made a maximum 147 break in round two last year, the fifth of his career and the 12th time a 147 had been achieved at the Crucible, but would still go on to lose the match 13-11 to Jack Lisowski

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 21 July 1994, presented by Julian Clary and featuring Warren G. & Nate Dogg, the BC52's and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 28 July 1994, presented by Bruno Brookes, and featuring Let Loose, Erasure and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 22/04/1982: Peter Powell presents the April 22 edition, featuring music by Pigbag, Bananarama and Fun Boy Three, Elton John, Kim Wilde, Haircut 100 and Shakin' Stevens

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 20/04/1989: Nicky Campbell and Sybil Ruscoe host the edition first shown on April 20, featuring performances by Transvision Vamp, Inner City, Holly Johnson, Metallica, Midnight Oil, the Cure, Simple Minds, the Bangles and the Beatmasters with Merlin

programme.title: When Albums Ruled the World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the heyday of LPs from the mid-1960s to the late 1970s, as bands and singers embraced the creative opportunities they offered for music and artwork. The programme also examines how the arrival of new formats heralded the end of the album's golden era. With contributions from Queen's Roger Taylor, Noel Gallagher, Mike Oldfield, the Doors' Ray Manzarek, Slash and Grace Slick of Jefferson Airplane

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc:
Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath
S01E05

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 21 July 1994, presented by Julian Clary and featuring Warren G. & Nate Dogg, the BC52's and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 28 July 1994, presented by Bruno Brookes, and featuring Let Loose, Erasure and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: When Albums Ruled the World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the heyday of LPs from the mid-1960s to the late 1970s, as bands and singers embraced the creative opportunities they offered for music and artwork. The programme also examines how the arrival of new formats heralded the end of the album's golden era. With contributions from Queen's Roger Taylor, Noel Gallagher, Mike Oldfield, the Doors' Ray Manzarek, Slash and Grace Slick of Jefferson Airplane

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Line in the Sand: The actor begins his trek across the Sahara Desert. Landing in Morocco after crossing the Straits of Gibraltar, he proceeds to scale the High Atlas mountains and meets the Sahawari people, who provide welcome assistance in an inhospitable land. He also rides on the world's longest train, and plays a game of desert draughts
S01E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of two second-round matches. Mark Selby will be involved in one of these contests should he have come through his first-round encounter and will be looking to avoid his fate at this stage last year, when the 2021 champion relinquished his crown following a 13-10 defeat at the hands of Yan Bingtao

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise's attempts to make a fresh start are frustrated when she meets Frederik again. He involves her in a new case in which a disabled woman has been found dead. In Danish
S01E05

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise and Frederik discover a connection between Bjrn and Alberte, who both grew up in the Breidablik commune. Louise goes undercover and soon spots its charismatic leader, Jon. In Danish
S01E06

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Escape from the Stalag Luft 112B: British PoW Major Errol Phipps is determined to escape his German captors, but his constant attempts begin to exasperate his fellow prisoners. Eventually, they all manage to evacuate the camp, leaving him behind and believing the conflict is not yet over. Second World War comedy, starring Michael Palin and Roy Kinnear
S01E03

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Murder at Moorstones Manor: Members of the Chiddingfold family gather at their spooky ancestral home, leading to a series of deaths as one by one the eccentric residents are murdered and the house descends into inevitable chaos. Comedy, starring Michael Palin and Isabel Dean. First broadcast October 11, 1977
S01E04

programme.title: British Sitcom: 60 Years of Laughing at Ourselves
programme.desc: A journey through the history of the British TV sitcom, from Hancock's Half Hour in the 1950s to present day shows, revealing the inspiration behind some of the most enduring characters and how comedy has reflected changing attitudes in society. Narrated by Rebecca Front, and featuring contributions from writers and actors including Steve Coogan, Richard Curtis, James Corden, Graham Linehan, Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc:
Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: British Comedy: The critic returns to examines more of the techniques and conventions behind classic movie genres, beginning by looking at the tropes of British comedies. Mark argues that they win laughs by tapping into the public's abiding national preoccupations, from rooting for the underdog to the subversion of class and manners, as well as the audience's fascination with comedy and crime, and pastiches and parodies that take the big beasts of Hollywood down a peg or two
S03E01

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Line in the Sand: The actor begins his trek across the Sahara Desert. Landing in Morocco after crossing the Straits of Gibraltar, he proceeds to scale the High Atlas mountains and meets the Sahawari people, who provide welcome assistance in an inhospitable land. He also rides on the world's longest train, and plays a game of desert draughts
S01E01

programme.title: Measuring Mass: The Last Artefact
programme.desc: A hi-tech vault just outside Paris is the home of the kilogram, a small metallic cylinder that is used as the base unit of mass - it is the item against which everything else is measured. But over time, this small hunk of metal has mysteriously eroded by the weight of an eyelash, a change that could have dire consequences. This documentary tells the story of the kilogram, and follows a group of scientists as they try to redefine the weight of the world

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: All at Sea 2: The team heads offshore to examine stories related to the sea

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: An aerial view of England through the seasons, accompanied by verses from poets ranging from Shakespeare to Philip Larkin. With commentary from John Betjeman, and readings from Michael Hordern, Prunella Scales, Janet Suzman and Richard Pasco. Originally broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day nine at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as two second-round matches continue. Kyren Wilson and John Higgins could potentially meet should they have both won their first-round encounters, and the pair experienced mixed fortunes at this stage last year, with 2020 runner-up Wilson losing to Stuart Bingham and four-time champion Higgins prevailing against Noppon Saengkham

programme.title: The Alehouse Sessions
programme.desc: Norwegian violinist Bjarte Eike and his music group Barokksolistene present a joyful celebration of 17th-century folk music, fiddle tunes, drinking songs, sea shanties and pieces by Purcell and Playford, filmed in one of London's oldest taverns, the George Inn, Southwark

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new stepfather, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc:
Cezanne's Card Players: The story behind The Card Players, one of Cezanne's most famous artworks. Waldemar Januszczak considers how this image of two old men hunched over their game of cards expresses the artist's puzzling religious beliefs, particularly his fascination for Mary Magdalene
S01E04

programme.title: Christo and Jeanne-Claude: Monumental Art
programme.desc: Documentary which charts the creation of world-renowned artist Christo's first public work of art in the UK, the Mastaba. In the summer of 2018, on the Serpentine in London's Hyde Park, Christo constructed the Mastaba from 7,506 painted oil barrels. The work was inspired by ancient Mesopotamian tombs and weighs six hundred tonnes. It is the latest work in a career spanning half a century and stretching across the world, and the programme looks back on Christo's career and a life spent making provocative works of art with his wife and partner Jeanne-Claude

programme.title: Dawn Chorus: The Sounds of Spring
programme.desc: Filmed without voiceover or music, this programme highlights the call of the birds at sunrise, as those living within Britain's habitats burst into song and reveal the natural splendour of their distinctive chorus

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: An aerial view of England through the seasons, accompanied by verses from poets ranging from Shakespeare to Philip Larkin. With commentary from John Betjeman, and readings from Michael Hordern, Prunella Scales, Janet Suzman and Richard Pasco. Originally broadcast in 1977

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc:
Cezanne's Card Players: The story behind The Card Players, one of Cezanne's most famous artworks. Waldemar Januszczak considers how this image of two old men hunched over their game of cards expresses the artist's puzzling religious beliefs, particularly his fascination for Mary Magdalene
S01E04

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hanoi to Ha Long Bay: Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. Checking into its famous Metropole Hotel, he discovers a bunker where guests sheltered from American bombardment during the Vietnam War. At a former Soviet factory that once supplied military uniforms to the North Vietnamese army and Viet Cong, Michael discovers a progressive new manufacturer providing sportswear to the United States Olympic team. He later views the limestone islets and turquoise waters of Ha Long Bay
S01E10

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: Samurai Sword: Documentary about traditional Japanese craftspeople, beginning by following Shiro Kunimitsu and his family as they craft a katana of exceptional sharpness and durability, continuing a tradition begun by their ancestors nearly three centuries ago
S01E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 10 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of the final two second-round matches, as the line-up for the quarter-finals is confirmed. Jack Lisowski was the final player to book his place in the last eight in 2022, edging out 2010 champion Neil Robertson 13-12, and he will be involved in this session if he won his first-round match

programme.title: Flying Scotsman from the Footplate
programme.desc: A guide to life on the footplate of the nation's favourite steam engine. Cameras are placed aboad locomotive 60103 as it travels along the Severn Valley, cutting through stunning landscapes on a journey from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster. The 'cab cameras' capture veteran driver Roger Norfolk and fireman Ryan Green in action as they talk through the mechanics and challenges of operating this national treasure. Needless to say, things sometimes get hot on the footplate and not everything goes exactly to plan

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance
programme.desc: To celebrate its 90th birthday, Barbara Flynn narrates the story of the nation's love affair with the Flying Scotsman - arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, and one that symbolises all that was great about British engineering. In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc:
Guns and Government: Key players in the Good Friday Agreement relive the all-night negotiations leading up to the treaty, which saw the creation of a unique power-sharing government. However, Tony Blair's compromise on decommissioning failed to overcome local distrust, and once again, the British Prime Minister faces another Northern Ireland crisis. With contributions from Blair, Bertie Ahern, Bill Clinton and Mo Mowlam
S01E04

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hanoi to Ha Long Bay: Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. Checking into its famous Metropole Hotel, he discovers a bunker where guests sheltered from American bombardment during the Vietnam War. At a former Soviet factory that once supplied military uniforms to the North Vietnamese army and Viet Cong, Michael discovers a progressive new manufacturer providing sportswear to the United States Olympic team. He later views the limestone islets and turquoise waters of Ha Long Bay
S01E10

programme.desc:

S01E01

In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Bogor: Michael Portillo travels through Indonesia, starting out from the capital Jakarta and travelling south to the city of Bogor, where he admires its botanical gardens
S01E11

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: The Kimono: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress
S01E02

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 11 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second sessions of two quarter-finals. Three-time champion Mark Williams was among the winners at this stage last year, claiming a hard-fought 13-11 victory over Mark Selby's second-round conqueror Yan Bingtao

programme.title: The Crucible: 40 Golden Snooker Years
programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. The venue has become the home of snooker since the championships moved there in 1977, helping to create memorable moments and scenes of drama that live on to this day. Featuring interviews with former champions Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor, six-time runner-up and fans' favourite Jimmy White, and celebrity snooker addicts Richard Osman and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: The story of two women who fell in love on Christmas Eve, 1944, in the Ravensbrck concentration camp - a relationship that was kept a secret for many years

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Griff Rhys Jones's project nears completion - until he learns there is trouble with the roofs of the mill and the cottage. George travels to one of the last working watermills in Wales to get ideas for the mill's interior
S02E04

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Colours of Life: Early Earth was the canvas for a vast new palette, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the hue of their skin in order to hide from the world
S01E02

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: Monitor Me: Dr Kevin Fong explores the boom in apps and gadgets designed to help people monitor their health around the clock. He meets some of the pioneers of this revolution and visits a man who self-diagnosed a life-threatening disease from his own data, without going to the doctor
S50E02

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Bogor: Michael Portillo travels through Indonesia, starting out from the capital Jakarta and travelling south to the city of Bogor, where he admires its botanical gardens
S01E11

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: The Kimono: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress
S01E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 1/5: On the first dinner date in Middlesbrough glamorous 41-year-old sales assistant Gail hosts a night full of sparkly gourmet grub and teaches her guests a lesson or two in beauty. Her guests are 52-year-old vintage shop owner Jane, 28-year-old football coach Dan, 57-year-old art enthusiast Julie and 47-year-old pub landlord Gary. Gail gets the glitter, sparklers and hair extensions out, but whether her food will get glowing reviews ramins to be seen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 2/5: Goalkeeping coach Dan hopes to thrill his guests with a James Bond evening in Middlesbrough, including 007-inspired food and a Bond villain. however, Julie and Jane fail to 'bond' on the night, falling out over everything from who's been the best James Bond, to how to pronounce Roger Moore. Gary and Gail also fall out when the table chat turns to 'lookey-likeys'. After dinner, Dan challenges his guests to put one past him in a penalty shoot-out, which ends with a surprising result

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 3/5: In Middlesbrough, pub landlord Gary plans a 1980s evening, serving classic dishes with a modern twist. However, Jane and Julie are still bickering and Gary falls out with Gail over his dessert. Showman Gary flambs his steaks at the table, and tops things off with a magic display that goes down well with all of his guests - except one

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 4/5: Vintage shop owner Jane serves up a retro menu and a vintage clothes competition in Middlesbrough. Jane's been on the attack at the table so far, but she's planning to be the perfect host this time. On a lively night, there's more drama between the diners, and Julie and Gail discover that Jane has created headlines in the local news

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 5/5: On the last night in Middlesbrough, Julie's Indian menu gets mixed reviews, while Gail and Jane make a shoe discovery that leads to some shocking dinner table revelations. Gary finds out how much he's got on Jane's nerves throughout the week, as the contestants candidly reveal what they think of each other

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Costa Rica: With their two daughters ready to leave home, adventurous Preston couple Geoff and Sally Taylor are looking to wind down and spend more quality time together. They fell in love with Costa Rica when they visited it on holiday and have decided to buy a holiday home on its Pacific Coast, so Ben Hillman shows the duo five properties in the region within their 300,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: South Tenerife: Steve and Cindy Head first visited south Tenerife 20 years ago and the welcoming climate has kept them coming back ever since. Now, after years of dreaming, they are looking for their own holiday home to share with their family. Ben Hillman shows the pair five apartments within their budget of 120,000, but will any of them be up to scratch?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
In Portugal, a family dream of a new eco-friendly life. In France, a couple struggle to get their B&B ready for guests, and in Spain, a bike business starts again after Covid
S07E26

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 1/5: Head teacher Corinna hosts the first of five parties in and around Essex, hoping her royal-themed evening will impress her guests Paul, Grace, Harmy and Adam
S2018E50

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 2/5: Forty-seven-year-old money broker Paul hosts the second dinner party in and around Essex, aiming to impress his guests with an evening of fine dining
S2018E51

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 3/5: Teacher Harmy hosts the third night of the competition in and around Essex, hoping to impress her guests by serving up an authentic Punjabi feast
S2018E52

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 4/5: Recruitment consultant Adam is the fourth to host in and around Essex, and hopes to exceed expectations with a menu of posh nosh at his dad's house
S2018E53

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 5/5: The last to act as host is 24-year-old recruitment consultant Grace, who hopes to dazzle her guests with a glamorous party, Essex-style. With a menu full of home-made grub and help from her family along the way, it remains to be seen whether Grace has done enough to bag the 1,000
S2018E54

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Estepona: Retiree Maralyn and her daughter Nicola look for Maralyn's dream holiday home in Estepona on Spain's Costa del Sol, with its palm-lined promenade and whitewashed towns. Nicola plans to make full use of her mum's new place with her own family too. Jasmine Harman shows them five stunning properties, all within their budget of 230,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Mojcar, Spain: Chris and Lynne from Yorkshire have devoted their lives to looking after their six children and foster children. Now they're ready to find a holiday home in southern Spain that they can use for extended holidays with all their family. Laura Hamilton pulls out all the stops to show them five properties around Mojcar for their budget of 80,000

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Deborah Meaden, Jay Blades, Judi Love and Mike Wozniak take part in the culinary challenge. They must prepare Signature cheesecakes and a vegan version of a BBQ classic for the Technical, before recreating their first celebrity crush for their Showstopper. Presented by Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding, with judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith
S06E05

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and the family begin a new series by creating a traditional country house library, inspired by an 18th-century stately home she previously worked on. It will be covered from wall-to-wall in bespoke bookcases, with sustainable timber coloured to give it a rich, aged, antique appearance, and with another reading area to house more books - a cosy book nook on the landing. Graham installs the library's best kept secret - a hidden drinks cabinet
S03E01

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
I Love to Squander Promise: The comics take part in another selection of challenges, highlights of which include Jenny Eclair having a lovely time sitting on a chair while new potatoes cascade onto her head. Elsewhere, things get emotional - who can keep it together for the all-important sausage quiz? Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Mae Martin and Kiell Smith-Bynoe are the other four contestants competing for Greg Davies's golden head
S15E03

programme.title: Atomic Blonde (2017)
programme.desc: MI6 operative Lorraine Broughton is sent to Berlin before the fall of the wall to investigate the murder of a fellow spy and recover a missing list of double agents. The city is in a dangerously unstable state, and she finds herself targetted by multiple factions plotting to exploit the uncertain future for their own ruthless ends. Thriller, starring Charlize Theron, James McAvoy and John Goodman

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:

S01E03

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
The opening First Dater this time is 39-year-old Craig, a salesman who has fathered three children, each one with a different woman. Craig is hoping to find someone accepting of his modern family but has been left 'ghosted' on dating apps. His date is Becky, an insurance underwriter who is hoping to reclaim her dating A-game after four years of single life. Their date gets off to a rocky start when Craig drops the 'baby bombshell'. Searching for an adventure in love is 22-year-old Olivia, an avid gamer who feels forced to hide her secret 'geeky side' on dates. Olivia has struggled to find a fellow 'nerd' who she's attracted to and is on the hunt for a 'geeky James Bond'. Will her date, 27-year-old Tom be the man to leave her shaken and stirred? Ready to rock the restaurant is 30-year-old former holiday rep Billy. Having traded in his party lifestyle for something a bit more wholesome, running his own doggy day care, Billy is now looking for a companion to love. His date is 32-year-old
S20E01

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc:

The pair also enjoy a spot of canoeing along the River Wye and visit an ancient orchard to a pick some apples to munch on with some local cheese and cider

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:

As part of their renovation project, they added a three-storey 'tower' extension and used a range of unconventional techniques and alternative materials. Two years later, Kevin McCloud returned to find out whether the couple's methods led to success

However, Andrew loves this place. Kirstie tries to convince Michelle to stay by solving her kitchen problem and adding some feminine touches to the decor. programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc:

To this day, no one has been charged with the double disappearance and murder of the two friends, and their bodies have never been found despite two major police investigations and a missing persons campaign that featured the boys' pictures on milk cartons. But now, Emilia and David discover new evidence leading to a prime suspect

Storms wreak havoc for a family at their rural retreat in Portugal, while a plumping problem plagues a chateau B&B in France. In Spain, a bike business finally starts trading again
S07E27

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
A history buff tries to launch guided tours in Normandy, and on their rural retreat in Portugal, a family unveil their new eco loo
S07E28

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: Axarquia, Southern Spain: Laura Hamilton helps Marianne and Anthony from West Yorkshire search for their perfect holiday home in the Axarquia region of southern Spain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Almeria, Southern Spain: Matt and Sharron Powell want to start a new chapter in their lives by moving to Almeria in southern Spain, so Jasmine Harman shows them five options for a budget of 60,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Costa Blanca: Lee Juggurnauth helps West Midlands couple Lynn and Barry find a home on Spain's northern Costa Blanca, where they plan to permanently relocate along with their two cats Bob and Marley. Property expert Lee shows the pair the best of what their 180,000 budget can secure

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Estepona: Retiree Maralyn and her daughter Nicola look for Maralyn's dream holiday home in Estepona on Spain's Costa del Sol, with its palm-lined promenade and whitewashed towns. Nicola plans to make full use of her mum's new place with her own family too. Jasmine Harman shows them five stunning properties, all within their budget of 230,000

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Excitable French bulldog Buddy arrives at the centre. His owners have tried selling him seven times but every time he has been rejected. Can the staff finally find him a forever home? An eight-year-old girl who always wanted a small dog has her mind changed when she sees stray labrador Leah, and nervous collie Kimmie needs another dog to keep her company
S01E04

programme.title: Mean Girls (2004)
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rival's crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Revisit: Isle of Wight, 2012: In 2010, architectural designer Lincoln Miles and artist Lisa Traxler found an uninspiring 1970s bungalow on a plot on the Isle of Wight surrounded by ancient woodland. As part of their renovation project, they added a three-storey 'tower' extension and used a range of unconventional techniques and alternative materials. Two years later, Kevin McCloud returned to find out whether the couple's methods led to success
S12E09

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:
Jimmy Carr hosts and regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate as Jon Richardson and Jo Brand take on Joe Wilkinson and Jamali Maddix. Rachel Parris is in Dictionary Corner
S23E03

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
The first guests in the 20th series get off to a rocky start when 39-year-old Craig drops the bombshell that he has three children - all with different mothers. Avid gamer Olivia feels she needs to play down her interests when on dates, and hopes to meet someone who will accept them, while dog lover Billy is troubled to discover her date has tattoos of 40 people's names
S20E01

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E09

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Sarah from Plymouth becomes the first ever returning picker having previously been on the show as David. Now proudly pansexual and living as a woman, Sarah can't wait to road test her new body and hopes her first date as a woman will be everything she has dreamed of. Twenty year-old plumber Jamie from Swansea is fed up with being hit on by OAPs at work, he comes into the studio looking for love
S11E01

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
How Heavy Is the Water?: Kiell Smith-Bynoe finds himself playing bingo without any shoes on, Mae Martin plays an unusual but potentially brilliant drum solo and all the comedians create boats to carry eggs, in a race involving eggs in boats. Greg Davies hands out the scores, while Alex Horne hands out the tasks, designed to test the comedians' daring, dexterity and dignity under pressure - and to also make them look a little bit silly too
S15E04

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A rugby player is scanned for spinal damage following a collision during a match, and describes her struggles with mental health issues as she awaits the results. A teacher is knocked off his bicycle after receiving some bad news, while a man who broke two bones in his ankle after a fall is assisted by his dead wife's best friend
S24E07

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Costa del Sol: Danni Menzies is on Spain's Costa Del Sol, which as one of Europe's top golfing destinations is popularly known as the Costa De Golf. House hunter Peggy is a massive fan of the game and can't think of anywhere else she'd rather buy a holiday home, so she's counting on Danni to find her the perfect property. For her 115,000 budget, Danni tees up five options for Peggy to see along with her mother Coral, but will any score a hole in one?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
In Spain, a bike tour business gets ready for 50 Belgians. A flat tyre adds to a family's woes in Portugal, while cameras encounter a couple who are swapping one new life in the sun for another
S07E29

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
In Spain, the emergency services are called when a bike crashes on a remote mountain. In Normandy, a history buff leads his first battlefield tour, while a couple pack up their B&B in France and head to Mlaga
S07E30

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
The Lazy Pug: The first visit of the week is to The Lazy Pug in Warwickshire. Friends Ash and Rosie are hoping to win over their guests with quick rooms and a healthy dose of neon lights
S2022E56

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Crofts Hotel: The rivals head to the Crofts Hotel in Cardiff, run by chef Lorraine. However, the guests are uninspired by the bland decoration and feel that everything is a bit basic
S2022E57

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
The Hollybush Inn: The rivals spend the night at the Hollybush Inn in Priors Marston, Warwickshire, where owner Anthony hopes to wow his guests with the 16th-century coaching inn's history
S2022E58

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
The Pretty Thing: The guest house owners arrive at The Pretty Thing glampsite in St Osyth, Essex, run by Phil. There's a melee of mixed emotions when the guests arrive, with Lorraine and Anthony left feeling cold by the communal showers, while Ash and Rosie embrace all the impressive luxury their Aztec tent has to offer. Over drinks, Phil lets slip that the breakfast service the following morning will be his first ever
S2022E59

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Fri 14 Oct: Payment Day: It's the final day of the competition, and the B&Bers reconvene to feud about facilities, bicker over beds and cross swords over sausages, before the payments are revealed and the winner announced. Garish neon lights, dogs at breakfast and cleanliness issues are on the agenda as the hoteliers get heated while discussing a colourful week
S2022E60

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: Sierra Nevada: Communications director Kath and graphic designer Charlotte from east London cannot wait to escape their busy city lives by buying a Spanish holiday home around the stunning mountains of the Sierra Nevada, where it's possible to sunbathe on the beach and go skiing, all in the same day. Danni Menzies finds five options for their 120,000 budget, but will any wow them enough to want to put in an offer?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Tenerife: Laura Hamilton helps Steve and Jane find their first ever home together on the island of Tenerife, locating five options within their budget of 150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Fuerteventura: Laura Hamilton helps Alan and Carol, who want to spend their retirement on Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands, showing them five properties for their budget of 90,000. However, she soon finds the couple have totally different tastes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Costa del Sol, Spain: Childhood sweethearts Laura and Nick dream of making a permanent move to Spain with their beloved dog Poppy. They're after a property in Estepona on Spain's Costa del Sol that meets both their needs and Poppy's. Property expert Jean Johansson lines up five options for their 160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Chiclana de la Frontera , Costa de la Luz: Jonnie Irwin goes house-hunting in and around the attractive Spanish town of Chiclana de la Frontera on the Costa de la Luz, with chauffeur company owner Steve and export co-ordinator Janice. They both have busy lives and can't wait to buy their own holiday home that they can escape to for relaxing getaways with their family. They have a budget of 160,000 and are looking for a three-bedroom villa with a pool near the beach

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Barbados: Recently married house hunters Lildonia and Cory from London cannot wait to start a family, and for them there is no better place than a return to their Caribbean roots in Barbados. Will any of the five properties that Danni Menzies has lined up for their 250,000 budget fit the bill?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Villamartin: Lee Juggurnauth helps Harriet to find a holiday home in the popular resort of Villamartin on Spain's Costa Blanca on a budget of 110,000

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Brilliant Builds: Extending Your Home: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back to some of their favourite properties from the show and offers tips and tricks to help viewers make the best of their homes. As well as catching up with some of the families that previously featured, Kirstie and Phil focus on the layout issues and dilemmas that many of us now face in a very different world. In this episode, the pair focus the best ways to make a budget stretch, as two families with grand renovation plans look to make their money go a long way

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc:
Cockapoo Maggie and German shepherd Cody are brought in by their owners Diane and John, who have grown tired of Maggie's diva-like ways and cannot understand why she hates her pooch companion. Meanwhile, muzzled collie Marvin has left owners Laura and Dave at their wits' end. They are concerned by his lunging and nipping and fear he'll eventually bite someone. As trainer Jo begins the delicate process of earning Marvin's trust, there's no knowing how he'll react
S01E04

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and the family begin a new series by creating a traditional country house library, inspired by an 18th-century stately home she previously worked on. It will be covered from wall-to-wall in bespoke bookcases, with sustainable timber coloured to give it a rich, aged, antique appearance, and with another reading area to house more books - a cosy book nook on the landing. Graham installs the library's best kept secret - a hidden drinks cabinet
S03E01

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:

In Newcastle, GP Kathleen and her anaesthetist husband Tom have a three-bedroom Victorian semi in disorganised chaos with Tom's sporting gear taking root everywhere. Should they move on or reconfigure the downstairs?

programme.desc:

programme.desc: One-off special bringing the West End theatre show to TV

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

programme.desc:

S24E07

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
On the beat with the police officers who patrol the city of Brighton after dark. PC Jack gets called to a street assault, but finding out who is the suspect and who is the victim proves difficult. PCs Matt and Amelia find a bloody-handed youth on a bus after reports of a smashed window and PC Aj chases down a suspected house burglar
S01E06

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc:
The Secret World of Sweets: Jo Brand unwraps the nostalgic story of the world of sweets and lifts the lid on the biggest rivalries and innovations that have driven the sweet world. Jo unpacks the historic rivalry between Rowntree's and Bassett's before the cosy British sweet market gave way to a bitter battle after the arrival of Mars and Haribo, and key players from some of the industry's biggest brands reveal just how fierce the battle is to keep life sweet
S02E03

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
Ed and James bait the hunters into a showdown at Taskmaster House while Nik and Eva taunt them with a public appearance in Leicester Square and on the Heart Radio breakfast show. Katya and Aimee head up to Carlisle to reunite with some friends and Saffron and Bobby lay low on the south coast
S05E04

programme.title: Work on the Wild Side
programme.desc: Harriet and the team at Elephants Alive are on a mission to save three elephants known as the 'naughty boys' who are breaking out of their reserve and destroying local crops

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 2/5: Fitness fanatic Jonny Thompson hosts the second night in Cumbria, where he hopes to wow his guests with a meaty menu - and they get to see a lot more of him than they had bargained for

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Three Cardiff couples compete to win 1,000 by throwing the perfect dinner part. First-time hosts Abi and Jake plan an American-themed menu. Their home-made fare impresses most of their guests, and their special effort for vegan couple Ashleigh and Jack is really appreciated. On night two, passionate vegans Ashleigh and Jack serve a fully plant-based menu designed to satisfy even the most committed meat eaters, but their rivals aren't convinced that they can be converted. On the final night, Karen and James are confident a more traditional menu will show the 'youngsters' how it's done
S2020E24

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: South Africa's Garden Route: Jerry and Christine Steele's love of South Africa began decades ago and they have decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the beaches and national parks of the Garden Route stretch of the south-eastern coast. For their budget of 60,000, Laura Hamilton shows them five great value properties.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Costa del Sol: Although she's approaching retirement age, Karmen Meredith is in no mood to slow down. Instead, the Derbyshire woman is looking for a bolthole on Spain's Costa del Sol, so Danni Menzies shows her five properties to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:

S07E31

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting the Isle of Wight to meet a couple who have lots of unwanted militaria in their sheds. While Henry embarks on an ambitious project to turn y tank parts into hanging baskets, Simon plans to transform old insulators into studio flat lighting
S05E01

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 1/5: Laetitia Kotsiopoulos hosts the first dinner party in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, where she hopes an evening of French gastronomy and a menu that includes snails, veal and a traditional cheese course will impress her guests and win her the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 2/5: Eva Philippou hosts the second night in Birmingham's Sutton Coldfield district, where she tries to impress her guests with a Greek feast, and hopes that dancing as her choice of entertainment will see her leading the field. However, rivals Laetitia and Sharon remain confident about their chances

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 3/5: In the Birmingham suburb of Sutton Coldfield, publican Randy Johnson wants to prove that he can put on more than mediocre pub grub, and tries to impress his guests with a black-tie theme and some interesting culinary techniques - including cooking with bricks. He surprises Sharon when he reveals that he used to sing in musicals, while Eva accidentally spits out a pistachio nut during one of her laughing fits

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 4/5: Lettings agent Sharon Wozniak hosts the fourth party in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, and she hopes to impress her guests with a classic West Midlands curry - but some diners are unimpressed by her menu. However, she manages to get French foodie Laetitia Kotsiopoulos to admit her wine was a good choice, despite being made locally. Later, her fish dish does not go down well with another contestant, so she hopes her deconstructed Margarita cheesecake can improve her chances of winning the prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 5/5: Outspoken hairdresser Patrick McMurray hosts the final party in Sutton Coldfield, and prepares a scallop starter and a classic beef Wellington. His first course goes down well, but Sharon soon becomes bored with his constant showing off - and it remains to be seen whether his saucy entertainment will prove a hit with the female guests

programme.desc:

programme.title: Ghost Writer (2007)
programme.desc: A composer takes in a penniless writer, but when he realises his kindness is being cruelly exploited, he kills his guest in a fit of rage. To make up for his crime, he arranges to have the dead author's last work posthumously published - but when he takes credit for the work, his victim's spirit returns to haunt him. Black comedy, directed by and starring Alan Cumming. With David Boreanaz and Anne Heche

programme.title: Rampart (2011)
programme.desc: A bigoted, misanthropic cop frequently breaks the law in carrying out his duty, while maintaining a complex home life with his two ex-wives. When he is caught on camera beating a suspect, the ensuing investigation brings his past offences to light, and his refusal to change threatens to tear his world apart. Crime drama, starring Woody Harrelson, Ned Beatty, Ben Foster, Cynthia Nixon and Anne Heche

Period drama, with James McAvoy, Christopher Plummer and Helen Mirren

programme.desc: Cousins Vincent and Anton are players in the high-stakes game of high-frequency trading. Writer/director Kim Nguyen's drama, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Salma Hayek

programme.desc: A woman has a whirlwind romance in Italy and decides to get married. Musical comedy featuring a soundtrack of 1980s pop songs, starring Hannah Arterton and Greg Wise

programme.desc: A weekend getaway turns deadly when a mysterious nightclub owner introduces a group of friends to a dangerous new designer drug. Thriller, starring Pierce Brosnan

programme.title: The Nines (2007)
programme.desc: An actor's drug-fuelled misadventures leave him under house arrest in a building he believes to be haunted, a TV writer watches his sitcom collapse around him and a man is stranded in the wilderness with a mysterious woman for company. Drama following three connected stories, starring Ryan Reynolds in multiple roles. With Melissa McCarthy and Hope Davis

programme.title: Color Out of Space (2019)
programme.desc: A meteorite crashes in the backyard of Nathan Gardner's Massachusetts house, and strange occurrences develop. Director Richard Stanley's horror fantasy based on an HP Lovecraft tale, starring Nicolas Cage, Joely Richardson and Elliot Knight

programme.title: 10 Things We Should Do Before We Break Up (2020)
programme.desc: A single mother-of-two becomes pregnant following a one-night stand with a committed bachelor, but the unlikely pair try to make a go of it. Romantic drama, starring Christina Ricci and Hamish Linklater

programme.title: Need for Speed (2014)
programme.desc: A street racer is betrayed by a friend, and ends up being framed for causing a death during an illegal contest. Action adventure based on the video game, starring Aaron Paul, Dominic Cooper, Imogen Poots and Michael Keaton

programme.title: Larry Crowne (2011)
programme.desc: A middle-aged man loses his job, and decides to fill his empty days by returning to college. He develops a new circle of friends among the various outcasts who have enrolled, and falls for his public speaking teacher, who has become disenchanted with her job and her marriage. Comedy drama, directed by and starring Tom Hanks. With Julia Roberts and Cedric the Entertainer

programme.title: Bel Ami (2012)
programme.desc: A penniless, amoral war veteran arrives in 19th-century Paris planning to make a name for himself in high society. He succeeds in seducing a succession of wealthy women, manipulating them into aiding his advance up the social ladder. Drama based on Guy De Maupassant's novel, starring Robert Pattinson, Christina Ricci, Uma Thurman and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: Chi-Raq (2015)
programme.desc: Spike Lee's dark comic drama with Nick Cannon. After a child is killed by a stray bullet, a group of women find a unique way to take on the violence in Chicago's Southside by withholding sex. Spike Lee's comedy crime drama, starring Nick Cannon

programme.title: The Spy (2019)
programme.desc: Actress and stage star Sonja Wigert is recruited by Swedish intelligence to spy on Nazi officials during the Second World War. However, the situation is complicated when Nazi officer Josef Terboven makes her spy on the Swedes. Director Jens Jonsson's drama, starring Ingrid Bolso Berdal, Rolf Lassgard and Damien Chapelle. In Norwegian, Swedish and German

programme.title: Clara's Ghost (2018)
programme.desc: Clara Reynolds is fed up with constant badgering from her self-absorbed showbiz family and finds solace in - and guidance from - the supernatural force she believes is haunting her. Comedy thriller, starring Paula Niedert Elliott and Haley Joel Osment

Comedy drama, starring Amy Adams, Emily Blunt and Alan Arkin

As their passion cools, they each seek solace in relationships with others - she turns to a fellow immigrant, a priest who is losing his faith, while her husband is reunited with an old flame. Terrence Malick's drama, starring Ben Affleck, Olga Kurylenko, Rachel McAdams and Javier Bardem
